ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Calling All Heroes
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey Wulf thanks man The song I used was not the original song  that I had in mind but something completely different.   Think Gregorian Chant form one of the
ygData.messageBody:
Hey Wulf thanks man 
 
The song I used was not the original song  that I had in mind but something completely different.   Think Gregorian Chant form one of the Masters of Chant albums  and the theme was gonna be completely different.  But when i heard that Man O War was gonna be in  Orlando I wanted to check the date to see if I'd be able to make it down there to go seem em at the House of Blues.  Unfortunately  for me that fell on a night that I needed to be at work so  That went out the window but I was kinda surprised to see that  Man O War really wasn't that much  as a group any more and i came across DSG form the Man O War Online Store and was pleasantly surprised to see that David Shankle  was still doing music and I saw the original video for "Calling All Heroes" and decided to rework the Theme  for the film centering around the song.
 
What's bad is it took me up to this vid of the 4 or 5 previous to figure out how to keep the shots in sync with the song lol and actually give people an idea of how long they were gonna need to wait in regards to Download time.
 
And this film is literally the largest yet out of all my past ones. 
 
Just as an FYI  I had full graphics on for all the vid caps used in the film  except for the use of Shadows.  Already with a system that has an AMD Athlon 1.4Gig processor with 1Gig Ram and a Geforce 5500 FX 256MB vid card I tended to lag as you could tell by the vid caps and Thats with  running WinEQ 2.0 Pro  to play Eq all the time and using that proggie for the vid caps, my FPS is at anywhere between 29 to 35FPS out of 40 but when I turn on the shadows it takes my FPS down to almost nothing  and WinEQ actually helps cut down cpu usage.
 
Once I had the viid caps I use Sorenson Squeeze to convert all or part of the vid caps into a workable format to be used  in combining those and the stills using Flash MX 2004 Pro
 
Took me forever to get the FPS for the film to be just right as well as figuring out how to get the last few stills to appear  the way they do at the right time. 
 
once I had the .swf file saved i used Flash Optimizer to  optimize the film  to the least amount of size possible and not  compromise the quality of the whole thing .  Managed to get the .swf file from 100MB to 79MB Any lower and the quality of the whole appearance went all to hell in a hand basket and back
 
Oh and Stephen   I took care of what you  mentioned and managed to get that uploaded and also  fixed a minor blooper at the end of the film as well  thanks for the input. 
 
Halyburton
70 Barb Fateseer
Legion of Vengeance
Saryrn
(aka Kwasi)
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Wulfric Rennison
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, August 02, 2005 5:26 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Calling All Heroes

hey Kwasi, glad to see you're still doing these videos, they're fun tow atch and you have ood musical selections.   You should try drawing some speech bubbles with some one liner comments for the action that's happening.  Pretty cool.
 
Wulfric
